turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Trailfinders.
turn.1: What is the difference between new age and traditional tour planning?
turn.2: Trailfinders  Trailfinders is a British travel company in the United Kingdom and Ireland.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It is the largest independently owned travel company in the United Kingdom, and has 31 travel centres in the UK and three in Ireland.
turn.5: Do they plan the whole trip?
turn.6: The company "specialises in tailormade travel worldwide" including Australia, New Zealand, North & South America, Asia & Africa.
turn.8: Trailfinders was founded by former SAS-officer Mike Gooley in October 1970 in an office of four staff based in a top-floor ‘garret’ on Earls Court Road in London.
turn.10: Initially, the business specialised in overland trips "I went to Thomas Cook and asked about overland trips to Kathmandu," Mike Gooley recalls. "They said 'we don't do that - we're a travel agency'.
turn.11: What did the public think of the company?
turn.12: In 1972 Trailfinders became the UK's first flight consolidator and advertised discounted air tickets in the national press.
